Name: Jar in Shape of Rooster
Description: The jar in the shape of a rooster was used to store liquids. The rooster is stretching its neck to sing. Its crest is red and the beak is the opening for pouring out the liquid.The body is decorated with impressions, or marks produced on a surface by pressure. The body has the typical colors for this kind of bird, especially the red.This piece was found in Rakhotis in Alexandria during the Imperial era. The pottery jar is representative of Coptic art with its beauty and simplicity.
